options.text: Selection of recombinants due to inactivation of antibiotic is a cumbersome procedure.
Insertional inactivation of  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">β</mi></math> -galactosidase leads to colourless colonies.
Insertional inactivation of  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">β</mi></math> -galactosidase leads to blue color colonies.
In insertional inactivation, the rDNA is inserted within the coding sequence of an enzyme  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">β</mi></math> -galactosidase.

solution.text: In PUC plasmid having Lac Z gene as selectable marker, it produces enzyme  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">β</mi></math> -galactosidase. If bacteria having PUC plasmid is grown in medium having chromogenic substrate, than non recombinants produces colourless colonies and in recombinants due to insertional inactivation  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">β</mi></math> -galactosidase is not produced thus colourless colonies are produced.
